channel.title: Chef/Puppet on IT Talks
channel.description: Recent content in Chef/Puppet on IT Talks

item.title: ERROR: The missing cookbook(s)
item.description:
If you received error uploading cookbook to chef server:

knife cookbook upload rundeck
Uploading rundec
ERROR: Cookbook rundeck depends on cookbooks which are not currently
ERROR: being uploaded and cannot be found on the server.
ERROR: The missing cookbook(s) are: ‘java’ version ‘>= 0.0.0’, ‘yum’ version ‘>= 0.0.0’, ‘apt’ version ‘>= 0.0.0’, ‘supervisor’ version ‘>= 0.0.0’, ‘database’ version ‘>= 0.0.0’, ‘mysql2_chef_gem’ version ‘~> 1.0.2’, ‘mysqld’ version ‘~> 1.0.3’

item.title: Installing Chef on Centos 6
item.description:
Today we will install chef server in our home lab based on proxmox 3.4.6. So we have installed server 2cpu, 2Gb memory, Centos 6.7

First of all I switched off selinux, and configured hostname of server in /etc/sysconfig/network and /etc/hosts

Let’s go on:

#wget https://web-dl.packagecloud.io/chef/stable/packages/el/6/chef-server-core-12.1.2-1.el6.x86_64.rpm

# rpm -Uvh chef-server-core-12.1.2-1.el6.x86_64.rpm

item.title: Cooking with Chef: How to deploy instance on AWS with knife
item.description:
Today I want to try provisioning and configuring Amazon AWS instances with Chef. To do that I have:

  • Free tier account on AWS
  • Open Source Chef Server 12
  • Ubuntu Workstation with knife

item.title: Knife-vsphere installation errors
item.description:
Today I tried to install knife vsphere support for Chef (You can make it by this command $gem install knife-vsphere ) on Ubuntu and received several errors.

First of them was:

item.title: Chef Manage install: RuntimeError – I don’t know how to install addons for platform family

item.title: Execute bash script by puppet
item.description:
We need to execute bash script on several servers. To do it manually – bad idea. But we have puppet. Lets make it by puppet.

  • Create bash script name.sh.
  • Create new manifest and apply it to our servers:
